com.thetransactioncompany.cors
Class Origin

java.lang.Object
  com.thetransactioncompany.cors.Origin
Direct Known Subclasses:
ValidatedOrigin
public class Origin
extends java.lang.Object

Resource request origin (not validated), as defined in The Web Origin Concept (RFC 6454).

Use validate() to check the origin syntax or if you want to query its scheme, host and port.

Origin examples: 

 http://www.example.com
 https://sso.example.com:8080
 http://192.168.0.1
 file:///data/file.html
 null

Version:
1.5 (2012-10-19)
Author:
Vladimir Dzhuvinov, Luis Sala, Jared Ottley

Constructor Detail

Origin

public Origin(java.lang.String value)
Creates a new origin from the specified URI string. Note that the syntax is not validated.

Parameters:
value - The URI string for the origin. Must not be null.
Method Detail

validate

public ValidatedOrigin validate()
                         throws OriginException
Returns a validated instance of this origin.

Throws:
OriginException - If the value doesn't represent a valid and supported origin string.
